title: 109_hr6300
content: The Act is titled the "National Archives 75th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act." The Congress acknowledges the 75th Anniversary of the National Archives Building, which houses the Charters of Freedom. The National Archives and Records Administration is a vital resource for American democracy, ensuring public access and trust in government records. The National Archives and Records Administration plays a crucial role in preserving government records, ensuring access to essential documentation for American citizens, and promoting democracy and historical understanding. The National Archives Building, opened in 1935, features a grand rotunda displaying key historical documents. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint $1 coins with specific specifications, including weight, diameter, and metal composition. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. Design and quantities of the coins will be determined as per section 4 of the Act. The coins minted under this Act will honor the National Archives Building and the National Archives and Records Administration. The obverse will represent the 75th Anniversary of the National Archives Building, while the reverse may feature images of the Declaration of Independence and the United States Constitution. Under this Act, $1 coins will be minted featuring images of the Constitution of the United States and the Bill of Rights. Each coin will also include inscriptions of the value, year "2010", and words like "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Foundation for the National Archives, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. The $1 coins featuring images of the Constitution and the Bill of Rights will be minted. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Foundation for the National Archives, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a designated Mint facility during a specific period in 2010. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, surcharge, and design costs. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will receive a reasonable discount. The Secretary will consult with the National Archives for promotion. The Secretary will consult with the National Archives to explore their involvement in promoting the coins minted under this Act. If deemed beneficial, a memorandum of agreement will be established between the Secretary and the National Archives for this purpose. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. Sales must include a $10 surcharge per coin, with proceeds divided equally between the Foundation for the National Archives and the National Archives and Records Administration Trust Fund for public programs and educational outreach. Audits will be conducted on the funds received.
